Description: Amulet of Taweret: standing, in the round, with suspension loop. Probably moulded. The body is in opaque black glass its surface almost entirely covered with opaque red and white 'spots' applied by the spatter technique. The feet and tip of the tail are distinguished.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: C. Andrews, 'Amulets of Ancient Egypt' (London, 1994): fig.66; Sale Catalogue, Henry Salt Collection, Sotheby, London, 28 June – 8 July 1835, lot 619.
